entry.title: The NHS Bodies (Transfer of Trust Property) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order transfers to the relevant new NHS bodies, property held on trust by the relevant old NHS bodies and makes related provision. Copies of the schedules of trust property transferred under this Order can be obtained from the Department of Health, Quarry House, Quarry Hill, Leeds LS2 7UE.

entry.title: The Community Drivers’ Hours and Recording Equipment Regulations 2012
entry.summary: This instrument gives effect to a Commission Decision, updates a definition in an existing set of regulations and revokes a set of redundant regulations.

entry.title: The Iraq (Asset-Freezing) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision relating to the enforcement of Council Regulation (EC) No. 1210/2003 of 7 July 2003 (OJ L 169, 8.7.2003, p.6) concerning restrictive measures in respect of Iraq (“the Council Regulation”).

entry.title: The Quality and Safety of Organs Intended for Transplantation Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations implement Directive 2010/53/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 7th July 2010 on standards of quality and safety of human organs intended for transplantation (“the Directive”). These Regulations impose quality and safety requirements in relation to the procurement and transplantation of organs intended for transplantation.

entry.title: The Scarborough and North East Yorkshire Health Care National Health Service Trust (Dissolution) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order provides for the dissolution on 1st July 2012 of the Scarborough and North East Yorkshire Health Care National Health Service Trust established on 1st November 1991 and revokes the Scarborough and North East Yorkshire Health Care National Health Service Trust (Establishment) Order 1991 that established the trust.

entry.title: The Social Security (Information-sharing in relation to Welfare Services etc.) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations, made under sections 130 to 133 of the Welfare Reform Act 2012 (c.5) (“the 2012 Act”), prescribe the extent of information-sharing which is permitted under those sections.

entry.title: The Occupational and Personal Pension Schemes (Automatic Enrolment) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations are made under section 292A(a) of the Pensions Act 2004 (c. 35) and amend the Occupational and Personal Pension Schemes (Automatic Enrolment) Regulations 2010 (S.I. 2010/772).

entry.title: The Occupational and Personal Pension Schemes (Automatic Enrolment) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Occupational and Personal Pension Schemes (Automatic Enrolment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2010 (“the 2010 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Schedule 5 to the Anti-terrorism, Crime and Security Act 2001 (Modification) Order 2012

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Schedule 5 to the Anti-terrorism, Crime and Security Act 2001 (Modification) Order 2012

entry.summary: Part 7 of the Anti-terrorism, Crime and Security Act 2001 makes provision for the security of the pathogens and toxins listed in Schedule 5 to that Act. This Order modifies that Schedule by adding the virus listed in article 2(a). The bacteria and fungi listed in articles 2(b) and (c) are omitted.

entry.title: The Energy Act 2011 (Commencement No. 1) (Scotland) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order brings sections 10, 14(6) to (8), 15(4), 35(6) and 75 of the Energy Act 2011 into force on 22nd June 2012.

entry.title: The National Health Service (Local Pharmaceutical Services) Amendment Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend Schedule 2 to the National Health Service (Local Pharmaceutical Services etc.) Regulations 2006, which sets out terms of service for contractors who provide local pharmaceutical services under arrangements with Primary Care Trusts.

entry.title: The Public Bodies Act 2011 (Transitional Provision) Order 2012
entry.summary: Article 2 of this Order confers on the Secretary of State the accounting and reporting functions of the regional development agencies (other than the London Development Agency) under sections 14, 15 and 17 of the Regional Development Agencies Act 1998 in respect of any accounting period commencing after 31st March 2012. The regional development agencies covered by this Order ceased most of their operations on 30th March 2012 and the Secretary of State will take responsibility for producing their final statements of accounts and annual reports.

entry.title: The Pensions (2008 No. 2 Act) (Commencement No. 8) Order (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation sections 14 and 28 of the Pensions (No. 2) Act (Northern Ireland) 2008 (“the Act”) as amended by the Pensions Act (Northern Ireland) 2012 (c. 3 (N.I.)) (“the 2012 Act”), in so far as they are not already in operation, on 8th June 2012.

entry.title: The Pensions (2008 Act) (Commencement No. 4) Order (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation further amendments contained in the Pensions Act (Northern Ireland) 2008 (“the Act”) in consequence of the abolition of contracting-out of the state additional pension for defined contribution pension schemes from 6th April 2012. The Order brings into operation—

entry.title: The Local Elections (Declaration of Acceptance of Office) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order prescribes the form of declaration of office for members and elected mayors of country, district, London borough and parish councils in accordance with section 83 of the Local Government Act 1972. The declaration must be made within two months of election for county, district and London borough councillors or, in the case of parish councillors, in accordance with section 83(4) of the 1972 Act.

entry.title: Act of Adjournal (Criminal Procedure Rules Amendment No. 2) (Miscellaneous) 2012
entry.summary: This Act of Adjournal amends the Criminal Procedure Rules 1996.

entry.title: The Football Spectators (Seating) Order 2012

ukm:Subject.Value: SPORTS GROUNDS AND SPORTING EVENTS, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: SPORTS GROUNDS AND SPORTING EVENTS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This Order directs the Sports Grounds Safety Authority to include in any licence to admit spectators to the New York Stadium a condition imposing the requirements that only seated accommodation is to be provided for spectators at a designated football match and that spectators are only to be admitted to watch such a match from seated accommodation. In order to admit spectators to a designated football match, which would include any association football match played at this ground, a licence is required under the Football Spectators Act 1989.

entry.title: The Pensions (2012 Act) (Commencement No. 1) Order (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation certain provisions of the Pensions Act (Northern Ireland) 2012 (“the 2012 Act”) on 7th June 2012.

entry.title: The Relevant Authorities (Disclosable Pecuniary Interests) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: Section 30 of the Localism Act 2011 provides that a member or co-opted member of a relevant authority as defined in section 27(6) of the Localism Act 2011, on taking office and in the circumstances set out in section 31, must notify the authority’s monitoring officer of any disclosable pecuniary interest which that person has at the time of notification. These Regulations specify what is a pecuniary interest. Section 30(3) of the Act sets out the circumstances in which such an interest is a disclosable interest.

entry.title: Act of Sederunt (Rules of the Court of Session Amendment No. 3) (Miscellaneous) 2012
entry.summary: This Act of Sederunt makes amendments to the Rules of the Court of Session 1994.
